title: Requires state campgrounds to provide a reduced fee for campsites to persons 65 or over
summary: Provides that the office of parks, recreation & historic preservation or any other agency setting fees for the use of overnight camping facilities shall set such rate at five dollars for residents of the state 65 years of age or over for the use of such facilities.
lawSection: Parks, Recreation and Historic Preservation Law
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          277

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M. of A. DINOWITZ, ENGLEBRIGHT, J. RIVERA -- Multi-Spon-
         sored by -- M. of A.  ABBATE, ARROYO, DESTITO, FINCH,  JAFFEE,  MAGEE,
         MAISEL,  McENENY, PAULIN -- read once and referred to the Committee on
         Aging

       AN ACT to amend the parks, recreation and historic preservation law,  in
         relation  to reduced campsite fees for persons sixty-five years of age
         or older

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.    The  parks, recreation and historic preservation law is
    2  amended by adding a new section 13.20 to read as follows:
    3    S 13.20  OVERNIGHT CAMPING FEES FOR THE ELDERLY.  THE OFFICE  AND  ANY
    4  OTHER  STATE  AGENCY  SETTING  FEES FOR THE USE OF ANY OVERNIGHT CAMPING
    5  FACILITY SHALL SET THE RATE AT FIVE DOLLARS FOR RESIDENTS OF  THE  STATE
    6  WHO ARE SIXTY-FIVE YEARS OF AGE OR OVER FOR THE USE OF SUCH FACILITIES.
    7    S  2.   This act shall take effect on the thirtieth day after it shall
    8  have become a law.





        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD01872-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the parks, recreation and historic preservation law, in relation to reduced campsite fees for persons sixty-five years of age or older
